titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: The weather became suddenly warm with the consequence that I was dilapidated & unworkable. In the afternoon I walked with Beeching & in the evening dined at the Stationers' Hall with the Livery Club of the Company of Musicians. I proposed the toast of the Company in a futile little speech, which, however, was well listened to. After dinner some excellent music, vocal & instrumental, was provided.
